wikipedia_page.main: Nora Kershaw Chadwick CBE FSA FBA (28 January 1891 – 24 April 1972) was an English philologist who specialized in Anglo-Saxon, Celtic and Old Norse studies.

response: Nora Kershaw Chadwick (1959)Chadwick, Nora K. "The Monsters and Beowulf". The Anglo-Saxons: Studies in Some Aspects of Their History. Ed. Peter ed Clemoes. London: Bowes & Bowes, 1959. 171–203. and later Helen Damico in two works (Beowulf's Wealhtheow and the Valkyrie TraditionDamico, Helen. Beowulf's Wealhtheow and the Valkyrie Tradition. Madison, Wis.: University of Wisconsin Press, 1984 and "The Valkyrie Reflex in Old English Literature")Damico, Helen. "The Valkyrie Reflex in Old English Literature". In New Readings on Women in Old English Literature. Eds. Helen Damico and Alexandra Hennessey Olsen. Bloomington: Indiana University Press, 1990. 176–89 argue that Grendel's mother may refer to the myth of the valkyries. Damico states:
